'''Andy Fish''' is a [[graphic novelist]], comic book artist, illustrator, painter, and educator. He is known for his graphic novels and his series of books on how to illustrate in certain styles.<ref name='friendly'>{{cite news| url=http://www.bellinghambulletin.com/2015/01/30/60609/friendly-neighborhood-comics-celebrates-6-years-in-business | location=Bellingham, MA | work=BellinghamBulletin.com | title=Friendly Neighborhood Comics Celebrates 6 Years in Business | date=2015-01-30}}</ref>
==Education== Fish attended the [[School of Visual Arts]] in New York City, doing undergraduate studies in Comic Art and Illustration. At the School of Visual Arts, Fish studied under [[Will Eisner]], a pioneer of the graphic novel medium.<ref name = "beacon">{{cite web | url=http://www.berkeleybeacon.com/news/2008/3/26/graphic-novel-program-could-become-new-major | title=Graphic Novel Program Could Become New Major | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> At the [[Rhode Island School of Design]] he did post-graduate studies in Illustration and Painting.<ref name = "bio">{{cite web | url= http://andy-fish-um10.squarespace.com/read-me | title=Andy Fish - Bio | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref>
==Books== ==="How to Draw" Series=== Fish is the author and artist of several "how-to" illustration books published by Chartwell Books.<ref name = "Amazon">{{cite web | url= https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss?url=search-alias%3Dstripbooks&field-keywords=andy+fish&rh=n%3A283155%2Ck%3Aandy+fish | title=Amazon - Books by Andy Fish | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> They include: * 2011 - ''How To Draw Superheroes'', Chartwell Books, {{ISBN|978-0785827184}} * 2011 - ''How To Draw Supernatural Beings'', Chartwell Books, {{ISBN|978-0785827177}} * 2010 - ''How To Draw Graphic Novel Style'', Chartwell Books, {{ISBN|978-0785826705}} * 2010 - ''How To Draw Tattoo Style'', Chartwell Books, (with Veronica Hebard), {{ISBN|978-0785826699}}
===Graphic novels and comics === Fish is the author and artist of the following graphic novels and comics: * 2018- ''Blackwood'', Dark Horse Comics * 2014- ''Geeks & Greeks'', Relentless Goat Productions, {{ISBN|978-0996350440}} * 2012- ''Dracula's Army'', McFarland Press {{ISBN|978-0786475827}} * 2011 - ''Dracula: The Dead Travel Fast'', Robo Picto Books, {{ISBN|978-1-4507-2895-9}} * 2011 - ''Werewolves of Wisconsin'', McFarland Press, {{ISBN|978-0786467983}} * 2007 - ''The Tragic Tale of Turkey Boy: An American Love Story'', Under Cover Books * 2007 - ''Fly: A True Story Completely Made Up'', Under Cover Books * 2004 - ''Requiem, 24 Pages in 24 Hours'', Blue Monkey Comics * 2004 - ''Jerry Claus: The Return of Dark Santa'', Blue Monkey Comics * 2000 - ''Adam Bomb vs. the Moon Menace'', Blue Monkey Comics * 1999 - ''Adam Bomb'', Blue Monkey Comics * 1997 - ''Cable'', Marshall Comics
===''Blackwood''=== In February 2018 Dark Horse Comics announced that it would be publishing a new horror/comedy mini series written by [[Evan Dorkin]] and illustrated by the husband and wife team of Andy and [[Veronica Fish]]. <ref name = "AVCLUB">{{cite web | url= https://www.avclub.com/dark-horse-opens-enrollment-to-a-college-of-horrors-in-1822760990 | title=Dark Horse opens enrollment to a college of horrors in this Blackwood exclusive | accessdate=2018-02-06}}</ref>
Released on May 30, 2018, ''Blackwood'' was a critical success<ref name="Geek">{{cite web |url= https://www.geek.com/comics/buy-this-comic-blackwood-1-1741498/ |title=Buy This Comic: Blackwood #1 |accessdate= 2018-05-30}}</ref> which cited the contributions Andy made to make the book a success.
Reviewer Insha Fitzpatrick on Geek.com wrote: ''"Andy Fish does all the silent back work for this comics, and it would be a shame if we don’t shout him out for it. He not only helps with color flats but also is an art assist and letterer to the comic. While everything he does for the comic is absolutely stellar, Fish’s lettering and layouts are absolute standouts.
''Fish’s layouts are easy to follow. Every one always builds on top, and they have their own variation and unison to them that builds the story in a suspenseful way. I absolutely love experimental layout where panels are on top of panels and Fish does this amazingly. He provides a space where Veronica’s art can breathe freely, so you soak in every detail. He also does a massively incredible job with lettering this comic. Again, allowing you to follow easily, but gives tons of variations on the balloon placement and sound effects. This is one comic where the sound effects were absolutely effective and essential to be placed perfectly, and Fish nails it."''''

==Comics== Fish has drawn the following comics:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://andyfishwrap.blogspot.com/2015/03/i-am-full-time-comic-book-artist-or.html |title=Fish Wrap |accessdate=2014-09-04}}</ref> * ''The Misadventures of Adam West: Vol. 5'', Blue Water Productions * ''Bagman at the World's Fair'', Airship 27 * ''Crimson Mask'', Airship 27 * ''Queen of Escapes'', Airship 27
Working on ''The Misadventures of Adam West'' was gratifying to Fish since he's always been a big fan of [[Adam West]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mobys.ws/03/02/andy-fishs-first-work/ |title=Moby's - Andy Fish's First Work |accessdate=2014-09-04}}</ref>
In 2017 Fish launched a vintage Batman comic serial, which comics culture blog ''13th Dimension'' called, "the best Batman comic never published by DC."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://13thdimension.com/the-best-batman-comic-never-published-by-dc/ |title=The Best Batman Comic Never Published by DC |last1=Greenfield |first1=Dan |website=13thDimension.com |date= 2017-04-02 |accessdate=2017-04-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://batmanbyandyfish.blogspot.com/p/death-ray-ebook.html |title=Batman by Andy Fish |website=BatmanByAndyFish.blogspot.com |accessdate=2017-04-04}}</ref>
==Paintings== [[File:Andy_Fish_illustration.jpg|thumb|right|The art of Andy Fish employs the use of vibrant colors.]] Fish's style employs a pop sensibility and the use of vibrant, super-saturated colors.<ref name='Kickstarter'>{{cite news| url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/stevealtes/geeks-and-greeks-an-epic-graphic-novel-about-mit-p/description | location=New York City, NY | work=Kickstarter.com | title=Geeks & Greeks – an epic graphic novel about MIT pranks | date=2014-06-12}}</ref> Fish's work has been exhibited in the Aurora Gallery in Worcester, MA, the Chashama Gallery in Manhattan, the Ad Hoc Gallery in Brooklyn, and galleries in Sydney, Australia.<ref name = "beacon"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fhcw.org/es/ArtInTheCity/MeettheArtists/AndyFish |title=Art in the City |accessdate=2014-09-04 }}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> One of his paintings is in the collection of the [[National Gallery of Art]] in Washington, DC.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://peggylchambers.com/2014/03/16/interview-with-artist-andy-fish/ | title=Interview with Artist Andy Fish | accessdate=2014-09-04}}</ref> Fish also participated in the 2008 Suckers and Biters Exhibit in Brooklyn.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://suckersandbiters.tumblr.com/chashama2008 | title=Suckers and Biters - Tumblr | accessdate=2014-09-04}}</ref>
==Teaching== Fish is an Adjunct Professor of Art at [[Emerson College]] in Boston.<ref name = "LinkedIn">{{cite web | url= http://www.linkedin.com/in/therealandyfish | title=LinkedIn - Andy Fish | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> He has also taught at the [[Worcester Art Museum]] and the [[Massachusetts College of Art and Design]].<ref name = "bio"/> Together with his wife fellow artist Veronica Fish, Andy lectures at schools and libraries on the subjects of writing, comics, manga, graphic novels. He also presents programs on how to develop a career as a professional artist.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.undercoverfish.com/ | title=Undercover Fish Group | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref>
==Clients== Fish has created illustrations for such corporate clients as [[Warner Bros]], [[DC Comics]], [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]], and [[Coca-Cola]]<ref name = "creative finder">{{cite web | url=http://thecreativefinder.com/portfolio-full.php?username=andytfish&gallery_id=9870#awards| title=Creative Finder - Andy Fish | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> and his comics have appeared in ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'', ''[[The New Yorker]]'' and ''[[The Boston Globe]]''.<ref name = "beacon"/>
==Awards== * 2014 - Boys and Girls Club Lifetime Achievement Honors<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.bgcworcester.org/about-us/alumni-hall-fame | title=Boys & Girls Club of Worcester - Alumni Hall of Fame | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> * 2014 - Pulp Factory Award (nominated)<ref name = "Emerson">{{cite web | url=http://www.emerson.edu/academics/professional-studies/certificate-programs/graphic-novel-writing-illustration | title=Emerson College - Graphic Novel Writing and Illustration Program | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> * 2012 - New England Newspaper Association Illustrator Award (nominated)<ref name = "creative finder"/> * 2005 - New England Newspaper Association Illustrator Award (nominated)<ref name = "creative finder"/> * 2005 - World Smile Celebration Illustration<ref name = "creative finder"/> * 2005 - INKY Award for best digital comic book<ref name = "Emerson"/>
==Personal life== Fish lives in [[Worcester, MA]] with his wife and fellow artist [[Veronica Fish]].<ref>{{cite web | url= http://veronicahebs.blogspot.com/p/about.html | title=Veronica Fish Illustration - About | accessdate=2015-08-04}}</ref> Andy and Veronica Fish also maintain a studio space in Nagoya, Japan.<ref name = "bio"/>
